alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille; Spokane; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 3:28PM PST until February 21 at 4:30PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Stevens County in northeastern Washington... Northeastern Spokane County in northeastern Washington... Southeastern Pend Oreille County in northeastern Washington... * Until 430 PM PST. * At 328 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles north of Deer Park to 12 miles south of Newport, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 302 and 327. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 175 and 183. Locations impacted include... Deer Park, Chattaroy, Otis Orchards-East Farms, Milan, Diamond Lake, Newman Lake, Elk, Mount Spokane and Sacheen Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
